entries.title: Resume
entries.description: An overview of my design leadership experience focused on design systems, AI integration, and cross-functional collaboration. Work history spanning enterprise products and startup environments.
entries.alt: Jacques Ramphal - Curriculum Vitae

entries.title: Design Tokens: The Unseen Hero in a Changing Design Landscape
entries.description: Why a shared design language is the most resilient investment teams can make as tools, roles, and workflows keep evolving. In a time when everything else in tech feels like shifting sand, design tokens are the bedrock—tiny pieces of your design's DNA that become a shared language everyone can speak, ensuring consistency and adaptability even as the design tools around them evolve.
entries.alt: Article: Design Tokens - The Unseen Hero in a Changing Design Landscape
entries.label: Read on Composable.com

entries.title: Designing Genie: Pioneering Agentic AI for Delivery
entries.description: Designing agentic systems forces you to rethink how work gets done. Not in the abstract, but in the day-to-day reality of delivery: shifting requirements, scattered context, rising risk, and teams stretched thin. This article explores how we built Genie—an agentic orchestration layer that consolidates context, generates requirements, surfaces risks, and automates workflows—and the three mental model problems we solved in designing for agentic AI.
entries.alt: Article: Designing Genie - Pioneering Agentic AI for Delivery
entries.label: Read on Orium

entries.title: Building Genie didn’t just change how we work. It changed me
entries.description: The story of building Genie—from personal experiment to organizational platform—and the three mental model problems we had to solve to design for agentic AI. A personal journey about reclaiming creative focus, learning new skills, and transforming routine work into strategic impact.
entries.alt: Genie - Agentic AI Platform

entries.title: The Shifting Landscape of Design
entries.description: The design industry is in a state of flux. The landscape is shifting, and the role of the designer is evolving. The days of the designer as a pixel pusher are long gone. The designer of today is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, and a storyteller. The designer of today is a leader, a collaborator, and a change agent. The designer of today is a business person, a technologist, and a futurist.
entries.alt: Article: The Shifting Landscape of Design

entries.title: Baselines & Design QA: Setting the Foundation for Quality
entries.description: How early baselines make Design QA effortless. When you set design baselines before implementation begins, you prevent problems from taking root. The result? Less testing needed later, fewer discrepancies to catch, and a shared understanding of what 'done' looks like.
entries.alt: Article: Baselines & Design QA

entries.title: The Value of Writing
entries.description: What am I trying to say? Do I even have a point?
entries.alt: Article: Writing for Non-Writers

entries.title: Leading Design Innovation
entries.description: How I focus on aligning design with broader company goals, ensuring it serves as a strategic, value-driving function rather than merely an aesthetic service. Exploring vision, technology, team strategy, and the evolution of design through AI, automation, and data-driven thinking.
entries.alt: Article: Leading Design Innovation

entries.title: The Best QA Is the One That Doesn't Have to Happen
entries.description: Prevention over detection in quality assurance. The highest form of QA is prevention—quality baked into baselines, components, and shared standards so that QA shifts from inspection to confirmation.
entries.alt: Article: The Best QA Is the One That Doesn't Have to Happen

entries.title: Quality Is Not Extra Scope
entries.description: Redefining quality as foundational, not additional. What adds scope is discovering misalignment late. When quality is built into the definition of done from the beginning, it becomes foundational.
entries.alt: Article: Quality Is Not Extra Scope

entries.title: Designers as Final Checkpoint
entries.description: Maintaining authority through validation. When designers act as the final checkpoint before release, they protect the integrity of interaction, communication, accessibility, and system coherence.
entries.alt: Article: Designers as Final Checkpoint

entries.title: Baselines Over Heroics
entries.description: Building sustainable quality through strong foundations. When your baseline is strong, quality becomes automatic. Mature teams invest in systems that make errors harder to produce.
entries.alt: Article: Baselines Over Heroics

entries.title: QA Is a Signal of Team Maturity
entries.description: How quality processes reveal organizational health. The amount of QA a team needs is inversely related to its maturity. QA reveals where friction lives.
entries.alt: Article: QA Is a Signal of Team Maturity

entries.title: Object Thinking vs. Spaghetti Thinking
entries.description: Modular systems create scalable quality. When systems are modular and reusable, quality scales. Reusable thinking creates reusable quality.
entries.alt: Article: Object Thinking vs. Spaghetti Thinking

entries.title: Manual vs. Automated Is the Wrong Debate
entries.description: The complementary role of human and machine intelligence. Automation is acceleration, not intelligence. The future of quality is machines for detection, humans for discernment.
entries.alt: Article: Manual vs. Automated Is the Wrong Debate

entries.title: Quality Is a Cultural Choice
entries.description: Building teams that value quality as foundational. Quality requires cross-functional respect, shared vocabulary, and willingness to slow down briefly to move faster later.
entries.alt: Article: Quality Is a Cultural Choice

entries.title: The Designer in the Age of AI
entries.description: Shifting from inspectors to system stewards. As tools automate comparison and regression, designers become orchestrators who define baselines, set standards, and protect coherence.
entries.alt: Article: The Designer in the Age of AI

entries.title: Delivering Fewer, More Complete Things
entries.description: True velocity through completion, not volume. It's better to deliver fewer tickets that are truly done than more tickets that will be reopened. Rework is invisible drag.
entries.alt: Article: Delivering Fewer, More Complete Things

entries.title: Smart Quotes Fixer (Package + CLI)
entries.description: A safe script that converts straight quotes to smart quotes in rendered content without touching code, bindings, or attribute delimiters.
entries.alt: Doc: Smart Quotes Fixer

entries.title: Design Guard (Package + CLI)
entries.description: A lightweight design guard that scans staged files for hardcoded lengths (px/rem/%/etc.) and colors, nudging code toward design tokens.
entries.alt: Doc: Design Guard
